Package dk.dtu.compute.se.pisd.server.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
dk.dtu.compute.se.pisd.server.controller.GameController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/games") public class GameController extends Object
REST controller for managing game-related operations. This controller provides endpoints for creating games, retrieving game information, updating player cards, and adding players to games.
Author:
Marcus Jagd Hansen, s214962

  • Method Details

    • createGame

      @PostMapping("/createGame") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Long> createGame()
      Endpoint to create a new game.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the ID of the created game.

    • getGameById

      @GetMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Game> getGameById(@PathVariable Long id)
      Endpoint to retrieve a game by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the game to retrieve.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the Game if found, or a not found status if not found.

    • getPlayerCards

      @GetMapping("/{gameId}/player/{playerId}/cards") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<String>> getPlayerCards(@PathVariable Long gameId, @PathVariable Long playerId)
      Endpoint to retrieve the cards of a player in a specific game.
      Parameters:
      gameId - The ID of the game.
      playerId - The ID of the player.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of card names if found, or a not found status if not found.

    • updatePlayerCards

      @PutMapping("/{gameId}/player/{playerId}/cards") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Player> updatePlayerCards(@PathVariable Long gameId, @PathVariable Long playerId, @RequestBody List<String> newCards)
      Endpoint to update the cards of a player in a specific game.
      Parameters:
      gameId - The ID of the game.
      playerId - The ID of the player.
      newCards - A list of new cards to assign to the player.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the updated Player if successful, or a not found status if not found.

    • addPlayerWithDefaultCards

      @PostMapping("/{gameId}/addPlayer") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Long> addPlayerWithDefaultCards(@PathVariable Long gameId, @RequestParam String playerName)
      Endpoint to add a player with default cards to a specific game.
      Parameters:
      gameId - The ID of the game.
      playerName - The name of the player to add.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the ID of the added player.
